SEARCH
Package DoctorManager

Class DoctorSchedule

java.lang.Object
DoctorManager.DoctorSchedule
public class DoctorSchedule extends Object
The DoctorSchedule class manages the schedule and availability of doctors. It allows viewing and updating a doctor's availability, checking available time slots, and managing the availability file for the next 7 days.

  • Constructor Details

    • DoctorSchedule

      public DoctorSchedule()

  • Method Details

    • viewDoctorSchedule

      public static void viewDoctorSchedule(String doctorID)
      Displays the upcoming 7-day schedule for a doctor, showing the available time slots.
      Parameters:
      doctorID - The ID of the doctor whose schedule is to be viewed.

    • displayAvailableTimeSlots

      public static String displayAvailableTimeSlots(LocalDate date, String doctorID)
      Helper method to display available time slots for a specific date and doctor.
      Parameters:
      date - The date for which available time slots are to be displayed.
      doctorID - The ID of the doctor whose time slots are to be shown.
      Returns:
      A string representation of the available time slots for the specified date and doctor.

    • updateDocSchedule

      public static void updateDocSchedule(String dID, String date, String time, String avail)
      Updates the doctor's schedule for a specific date and time slot.
      Parameters:
      dID - The ID of the doctor whose schedule is to be updated.
      date - The date of the appointment.
      time - The time of the appointment.
      avail - The availability status ("Y" for available, "N" for unavailable).

    • checkDocAvail

      public static boolean checkDocAvail(String dID, String date, String time)
      Checks if the doctor is available for a specific date and time slot. Prompts the user to enter a valid date and time if unavailable.
      Parameters:
      dID - The ID of the doctor.
      date - The date to check availability.
      time - The time to check availability.
      Returns:
      True if the doctor is available, false otherwise.

    • docAvailDates

      public static boolean docAvailDates(String filePath, String drID, String targetDate)
      Checks if the doctor has availability for a specific date in the CSV file.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the CSV file.
      drID - The ID of the doctor.
      targetDate - The date to check availability.
      Returns:
      True if the doctor has availability for the specified date.

    • docAvailTimes

      public static boolean docAvailTimes(String filePath, String drID, String targetDate, String targetTime)
      Checks if a doctor has availability for a specific time slot on a given date.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the CSV file.
      drID - The ID of the doctor.
      targetDate - The date to check.
      targetTime - The time slot to check.
      Returns:
      True if the doctor is available for the specified time slot.

    • initializeAvailability

      public static void initializeAvailability(String doctorID)
      Initializes the availability schedule for a doctor for the next 7 days, if not already initialized. Adds the doctor's availability for each day (from 8 AM to 5 PM) in a CSV file.
      Parameters:
      doctorID - The ID of the doctor whose availability is to be initialized.

    • updateAvailability

      public static void updateAvailability(LocalDate date, int timeSlot, String doctorID)
      Updates the availability of a doctor for a specific date and time slot. Toggles the availability between "Y" (available) and "N" (not available) for the selected time slot.
      Parameters:
      date - The date for which the availability is to be updated.
      timeSlot - The time slot to update (8 AM - 5 PM).
      doctorID - The ID of the doctor whose availability is being updated.

    • getTimeIndex

      public static int getTimeIndex(String time)
      Converts a time string (e.g., "EIGHT", "NINE") to its corresponding column index in the availability CSV file.
      Parameters:
      time - The time string to be converted (e.g., "EIGHT", "NINE").
      Returns:
      The column index corresponding to the time, or -1 if the time is invalid.

    • getTime

      public static String getTime(String time)
      Converts a time string (e.g., "EIGHT", "NINE") to the corresponding time in 24-hour format (e.g., "0800", "0900").
      Parameters:
      time - The time string to convert.
      Returns:
      The corresponding 24-hour formatted time string, or null if the time is invalid.

    • getTimeAlpha

      public static String getTimeAlpha(String time)
      Converts a 24-hour formatted time string (e.g., "0800", "0900") to the corresponding time string (e.g., "EIGHT", "NINE").
      Parameters:
      time - The 24-hour formatted time string to convert.
      Returns:
      The corresponding time string (e.g., "EIGHT", "NINE"), or null if the time is invalid.
